intro: Potentilla tauriciformis var. fortinata, commonly known as the Tauric Potentilla, is a shrub native to the steppes of the Caucasus region. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring many small, upright stems. The plant has narrow, elongated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces clusters of yellow flowers in the summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. This variety is notable for its compact growth habit and ornamental value in garden settings.
